title: Ghanshyam Binani
text:
Ghanshyam Das Binani (born 1932 – died 1998) was an Indian Marwari industrialist, and was the President of <a href="Indian%20Non-Ferrous%20Metal%20Manufacturers%20Association">Indian Non-Ferrous Metal Manufacturers Association</a>. His company, Cominco Binani Zinc Ltd. became the first producer of primary <a href="zinc">zinc</a> metal in India. As a tribute to his works, an Academy of Management Sciences associated with the <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh%20Technical%20University">Uttar Pradesh Technical University</a> has been named after him. There is also an award, Ghanshyam Binani Children's Bravery Award, named after him and it is awarded by Binani's company <a href="Binani%20Industries%20Ltd.">Braj Binani</a>.
Life history.
Binani (1932–1998) was an Indian Marwari industrialist, playing an active role in his father's ancestral business of trading in <a href="non-ferrous%20metal">non-ferrous metal</a>s. He had been the President of <a href="Indian%20Non-Ferrous%20Metal%20Manufacturers%20Association">Indian Non-Ferrous Metal Manufacturers Association</a> and had also been on the committees of <a href="Indian%20Merchants%20Chambers">Indian Merchants Chambers</a> and <a href="Federation%20of%20Indian%20Chamber%20of%20Commerce%20and%20Industry">Federation of Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry</a>. He, along with his father, set up <a href="joint%20venture">joint venture</a>s with <a href="Revere%20Copper">Revere Copper</a> and <a href="Brass%20for%20Copper">Brass for Copper</a> and <a href="Copper%20Alloy%20Extrusions">Copper Alloy Extrusions</a> and with <a href="Consolidated%20Mining%20%26amp%3B%20Smelting%20Company%20Ltd.">Consolidated Mining & Smelting Company Ltd.</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a> for manufacture of Electrolytic Zinc. With this came the birth of <a href="Cominco%20Binani%20Zinc%20Ltd.">Cominco Binani Zinc Ltd.</a>, on 2 August 1962, promoted by <a href="Binani%20Metals%20Limited">Binani Metals Limited</a> in <a href="Binanipuram">Binanipuram</a> on the banks of <a href="Periyar%20River">Periyar River</a> in <a href="Kerala">Kerala</a>. Cominco Binani Zinc Ltd. became the first producer of primary <a href="zinc">zinc</a> metal in the country and the first slab was cast on 21 April 1967. In line with their overall worldwide policy, <a href="Cominco%20Ltd.">Cominco Ltd.</a> also withdrew as financial collaborators of the company on 3 May 1991, and the company was rechristened Binani Zinc Ltd.
There is an Academy of Management Sciences associated with the <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh%20Technical%20University">Uttar Pradesh Technical University</a> named after him. There is also an award, Ghanshyam Binani Children's Bravery Award, named for him and it is awarded by Binani's company <a href="Binani%20Industries%20Ltd.">Braj Binani</a>.
